New Records: Endrick became the youngest male player - at 17 years and 246 days - to score an international goal at Wembley.
Key Match Events: Endrick scored the winning goal in the 80th minute after tapping into an empty net after Jordan Pickford parried a shot from Vinícius Júnior.
Pre-Game Insights: Brazil created most of the best chances including Lucas Paquetá hitting the post in the 35th minute.
England barely tested Bento who was making his first appearance for Brazil in goal.
Post-Match Reflections: It's a unique feeling. I'm still processing it,Endrick told Brazil's Globo television. 'I'm not much of a crier, I'm holding back, but it's something unique and I'm very happy.'
Southgate said 'it was a brilliant moment' for Endrick but said his defenders had failed to deal with the danger.
Southgate said he was happy with his team's performance overall, especially from the players who stepped up to replace England's more regular starters.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Aston Villa forward Ollie Watkins, leading the attack in Kane's absence, struggled to make an impact.
Endrick came close to scoring again in the dying seconds when he was through on goal but Pickford saved with his feet.
